The maximum noise voltage that a digital circuit can tolerate without changing logic levels.
The maximum number of inputs that a single output can reliably drive in a digital circuit.

Device A can reliably drive Device B if both of the following conditions are met:
  1. Voltage Compatibility:
    • VOH(A) ≥ VIH(B) (A's output high is recognized as high by B)
    • VOL(A) ≤ VIL(B) (A's output low is recognized as low by B)
  2. Current Capability:
    • IOH(A) ≥ IIH(B) (A can source enough current for B's high input)
    • IOL(A) ≥ IIL(B) (A can sink enough current for B's low input)
If any of these are not met, A may fail to drive B correctly.

Fall time – the time it takes for a signal to fall from a high to a low logic level.
